feed.title: SAP Community - SAP TechEd
feed.subtitle: SAP TechEd blog posts in SAP Community

entry.title: Shape What’s Next with SAP Integration Suite at TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community! 🚀 SAP TechEd 2025 is almost here!
Get ready to explore how we’re shaping the future of integration. Learn how SAP Integration Suite delivers on end-to-end integration requirements, discover how we’re driving modernization for customers, and see how enterprise automation can unlock new opportunities for your business.

Don’t miss the chance to gain insights, connect with experts, and experience the innovations that will power the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Join us at SAP TechEd 2025—in Berlin or virtually!

🚨Save the date and register today:  November 4-6, 2025 SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual 

What is in SAP Integration Suite track?

SAP Integration Suite empowers developers to drive innovation with an integration platform as a service (iPaaS) on SAP Business Technology Platform, which unifies on-premises and cloud-based systems, applications, events, and data. Discover how AI-powered capabilities in SAP Integration Suite can help harmonize user experiences and improve developer productivity and operational excellence across complex and diverse IT landscapes.

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions 👇 

 

Strategy Talk Sessions:

ST102 | AI in action: driving innovation and transforming integrations

ST100 | Modernize SAP Business Suite transformation with SAP Integration Suite

ST101 | SAP Integration Suite: Strategy and insights for the modern enterprise

 

Roadmap Sessions:

IN800 | Innovations, investments, and future road map for SAP Integration Suite

IN801 |Transition from SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite

IN824 | Harnessing AI, APIs, and events for strategic integration and innovation

 

Hands-on Sessions:

IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation

IN161 | Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture

IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite

IN166 | Central monitoring of integration scenarios with the SAP Cloud ALM solution

IN164 | Getting started with Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

IN260 | Master integrations: Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh

 

Deep Dive sessions: 

IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite

IN101 | Understand key concepts to accelerate B2B integrations

IN200 | Empower your agents to be responsible

IN201 | Enterprise integration artifact development with AI-driven optimizations

IN300 | Accelerate connectivity for your applications

IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture

IN301 | Streamline the development and governance of your integration strategy

IN302 | Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell

 

Visit our booths at Berlin:

IN906 | Move from SAP PO/PI to SAP Integration Suite

IN907 | Unify everything with SAP Integration Suite

🔍Don't miss out! Explore the TechEd 2025 session catalog and ensure your favorite SAP Integration Suite track sessions are on your list. We're excited to connect with you at the upcoming TechEd sessions. 

Don't know how to build your TechEd agenda? Learn more from this blog post: Put your thinking cap on! It’s time to make some tough choices… 

✨We can’t wait to see you there in Berlin!

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Virtual
entry.content:
Hi Community!

This year’s SAP TechEd Virtual is a great opportunity to explore the latest in application development. Since my main interests are SAP Fiori, CAP, and RAP, I’ve put together my expert playlist of sessions to watch.

Key Notes

KEY100v | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Discover how developers remain essential in the AI era and how SAP’s tools help us adapt.
 
KEY101v | Draft day for developers: Turning new technology into real-world wins
Learn how SAP’s newest tools and AI innovations accelerate coding, automation, and scaling.
 

Sessions

AD104v | Boost your ABAP development with Joule for developers
Explore SAP’s ABAP AI strategy, from faster development to custom AI scenarios using Joule.
 
AD106v | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build
Discover what’s new in SAPUI5 and SAP Build, including developer tools, Joule integration, and UI strategy with SAP Web Components.
 
ST109v | SAP Build: ABAP Cloud strategy
Learn about SAP’s ABAP Cloud strategy, covering ABAP AI, custom code transformation, integration with the SAP Business Data Cloud, IDE strategy, and support for the sovereign cloud.
 
AD820v | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions
See upcoming SAP Build enhancements with Joule copilot, CAP, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps to boost productivity and extensibility.
 

 Call to action

  • Not registered yet? Register now  👉 SAP TechEd | SAP TechEd Virtual
  • Join the SAP TechEd group and stay tuned 👉 SAP TechEd Group

entry.title: A day in the life of a cloud ERP implementation consultant at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
As a cloud ERP implementation consultant, I’m always looking for ways to sharpen my skills, stay on top of innovations, and connect with peers who face the same challenges in customer projects. For me, SAP TechEd has always been the place where all of this comes together and I’m sure TechEd 2025 in Berlin will be no different.

It’s not just about listening to sessions. It’s about walking away with concrete knowledge and hands-on experience I can apply on Monday morning with my customers. Here’s how I’ve built my personal agenda for TechEd 2025.

Hopefully, it gives you some inspiration for planning your own.

 

Day 1 - Getting started with the big picture

My first day is about getting inspired, hearing the strategy, and understanding the direction of SAP’s Business Suite and cloud ERP.

  • 9:30 AM - 9:55 AM CET:
    ST108 | Stop managing complexity: Start building what really matters
  • 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM CET:
    DT102 | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business
  • 12:30 PM - 12:55 PM CET:  
    PAR101 | Accelerate your IT transformation with process-aware agentic testing
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET:
    DT161 | Implementation experience for SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2 - Deep Dive into daily bread and butter

Day 2 is where I get into the practical details that matter most for my projects.

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT262 | Implementation accelerators for SAP Cloud ERP
    I need to speed up here to make it to my next favorited session. 😉
  • 12:15 PM - 1:00 PM CET:
    DT100 | From onboarding to go-live with SAP Cloud ERP
  • 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3 - Looking ahead and staying competitive

The final day is all about exploring future trends and preparing for what’s next.

  • 9:00 AM - 9:45 AM CET:
    BTM105 | Shaping the future with integrated IT and business process management
  • 10:30 AM - 10:55 AM CET:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 12:00 PM - 12:45 PM CET:
    AI105 | Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio
  • In the afternoon, I also plan to spend time at the demo pod.
    A great chance to discuss my long list of topics with experts and get practical advice for customer projects:
    DT917 | Cloud ERP implementation and transition paths

Final thoughts

As an implementation consultant, I know the daily reality: deadlines, requirements, and the pressure to deliver. SAP TechEd 2025 helps me reset, recharge, and return with new knowledge that directly impacts my work.

If you’re an implementation consultant like me, TechEd isn’t just another event. It’s where our role gets the spotlight and where we walk away better equipped to help customers succeed.

Save the date and register today 
November 4-6, 2025 
SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour – Bangalore 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP community enthusiasts! 

 Are you passionate about sharing your knowledge and experiences with fellow tech-savvy individuals attending SAP TechEd on Tour? Do you have innovative ideas or insights into SAP technologies that you think could benefit others? If so, here's an exciting opportunity for you to shine!  

We are offering Community Talks, which are 20-minutes session slots, to be filled by community members to share their knowledge with the community onsite at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore. Sign up as Community Talk speaker for our much-anticipated event taking place on November 25-26, 2025! 

As a Community Talk Speaker you’ll get a “Lecture-Only” ticket to attend SAP TechEd. Travel and Expenses are not covered by SAP.

Why Participate as a Community Talk Speaker? 

As a speaker at SAP TechEd, you'll be at the forefront of inspiring and engaging with technical professionals, developers, and business leaders. It's a unique opportunity to: 

  • Showcase Your Expertise: Share your unique insights, experiences, and innovations with a diverse audience. Hands-on, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  • Network and Collaborate: Connect with other SAP professionals, enthusiasts, and thought leaders from around the globe in the Community Theatre at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore. 
  • Expand Your Reach: Gain visibility in the SAP ecosystem and establish yourself as a go-to expert in your field. 

Topics to Consider 

We're looking for presentations on a wide range of topics that resonate with SAP TechEd's core focus areas. There are nine content tracks, please have a look at all of them on the SAP TechEd Event Website. These include (but are not limited to): 

  • Application Development and Automation 
  • Business Transformation Management 
  • AI and machine learning applications in SAP such as Business AI and Joule 
  • Breakthroughs in data management and analytics 
  • Integration 
  • Cloud Applications  

If you have a creative idea that pushes the boundaries of what's possible with SAP, we'd love to hear about it! 

Important Dates and Deadlines: 

To ensure you don't miss out, please keep an eye on the following important dates: 

  • Deadline for Speaker Applications and your Session Submissions: October 10, 2025 
  • Notification of Acceptance: October 17, 2025 
  • Final Presentation Submission for review: November 10, 2025 (if you don’t intend to have a presentation for your session, even better!) 
  • Date of the event: November 25-26, 2025 (ensure to be available on both days until the Community Talks schedule is finalized) 

How to Apply 

Think you're ready to take the stage? Here’s how you can apply: 

  1. Prepare Your Proposal: Outline the main points and objectives of your talk. Make sure it aligns with this year’s focus areas (see SAP TechEd Event Website for content tracks) and is tech-content (it should not be marketing products, services or companies).  Again, hands-on-style, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  2. Submit Your Application: Write an email to us and complete the email with all session details. Use this mailto link as it is prepared with all details for your convenience.  
  3. Document Your Passion: Highlight your enthusiasm and experience with SAP solutions—include any previous speaking engagements or relevant achievements. You’re very welcome to share an abstract of your session here in community.sap.com and gain feedback and reputation as a fellow community member.  

Join us in Bangalore! 

Let's make this year's conference inspirational and groundbreaking together. We can’t wait to hear your stories, ideas, and innovations. Join us and become an integral part of the SAP Community! 

Feel free to share this opportunity with your colleagues and networks who may be interested in speaking or attending. Together, let’s continue to push the boundaries of technology and innovation. 

We look forward to seeing you at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore!

entry.title: The Pragmatist’s Guide to AI: From Architectural Foundation to Real-World Value
entry.content:
Picture this: a demand forecast model trained on years of sales data looks perfect in testing, but once live, it misses a major promotion and a supply chain disruption because that data sits elsewhere. The model wasn’t wrong — it was perfectly wrong.

At SAP TechEd 2025, a joint session with Google Cloud will show how to close the Context Gap and unlock real business impact with AI. The session will explore:

  • The provocation – Casey West, Lead Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, reframes the AI challenge, introducing the Context Gap.
  • The proof in action – Laura Marwood, SAP Product Strategist for the SAP Business Suite will show a live demo on how SAP’s unified suite lets AI orchestrate seamlessly across roles and systems that turns chaos into growth
  • The architectural blueprint – Manoj Swaminathan, GM and CPO of the SAP Business Suite, Finance and Spend explains the foundation: a clean core, unified data fabric on BTP, and embedded AI by design.
  • The playbook – A practical maturity model guides teams from efficiency > productivity > true impact.

This is AI for pragmatists: closing the Context Gap with SAP’s suite-first strategy so AI doesn’t just generate output - it creates lasting business value.

👉 Don’t miss this session at SAP TechEd 2025!

https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1749125306565001Gf8a

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025 - Go Mobile!!!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on November 4th in Berlin, and preparations are in full swing! This premier tech conference is perfect for developers, IT professionals, business experts, and tech visionaries to deepen their knowledge of SAP solutions and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

We have prepared an exciting offering of mobile sessions for you: Strategic Talks, Roadmap and Hands-on sessions on Mobile Apps, Mobile Design and Mobile Technology. Furthermore, we will have a demo booth where you can explore our apps an Mobile Joule on your own. 

Certainly Mobile AI, is the focus topics this year. 

Here are some of the sessions I’m most looking forward to this year:

CA200 | An overview of our AI-enhanced mobile products across SAP Business Suite - Deep Dive
View demos of selected apps and learn how the latest mobile apps from SAP make it easier for your users to leverage SAP Business Suite on the go. You can build your own mobile apps the same way we do—start by exploring how we use SAP Design System for mobile apps as well as the latest technologies such as the Joule copilot and SAP Build solutions.  

ST112 | AI and the future of product and user experience on the web and mobile - Strategy Talk
Discover how the Joule copilot and embedded AI are transforming UX as well as how you can use AI to enhance and extend the UX for SAP Business Suite. See our strategy for giving users access to all they need and enabling them to provide feedback, wherever they are, through the web and on mobile, including applications and central services.

CA811 | User and product experience innovations by SAP—on the web and mobile - Road Map
Have a look at the latest user and product experience innovations across our suite of applications, along with cool innovations coming soon—on the web and mobile. Also, check out selected highlights from UI technologies.

AD170 | Build scalable enterprise mobile solutions with SAP Build - Hands-on Workshop
Dive into the technical details of building scalable, cross-platform mobile solutions with SAP. Get a hands-on overview of integrating SAP Build solutions and our mobile development kit to streamline your development process and deliver high-quality apps.

CA260 | Learn how to build your own app and use it in SAP Mobile Start - Hands-on Workshop
Build an application on SAP BTP using SAP Build Code and SAP Cloud Application Programming Model that integrates with SAP Mobile Start. Accelerate development with development productivity tools in SAP Business Application Studio. Learn how to make the app accessible and send push notifications for relevant business events directly to your users.

CA201 | Creating AI-enhanced UX for your own applications with SAP Design System - Deep Dive
Discover how AI is changing the idea of what an application is—and what this means for you. Learn about how to create AI-enhanced UX for your applications by using SAP Design System (SAP Fiori UX for web and mobile), and see how building applications is made easier through our AI UI technologies for web and mobile apps.

AD109 | Bridging the gap: Build your enterprise mobile strategy - Deep Dive
Are your employees struggling to find critical company data on the go? The SAP Mobile Start app solves that challenge by connecting them to SAP Build Work Zone and enabling custom mobile solutions. Find out how to create a powerful, integrated mobile journey for increased productivity.

AI166 | Mobile projects with SAP Joule for Consultants and SAP Joule for Developers - Hands-on Workshop
Learn how SAP Joule for Consultants accelerates execution of mobile projects and cloud transformation by simplifying knowledge access and offering expert guidance. Also, explore SAP Joule for Developers and its mobile development kit AI capabilities—including code suggestions, explanations, test generation, and more—to boost development efficiency.

CA914 | AI-based user and product experience innovations on the web and mobile - Demo Station
Experience the latest user and product experience innovations by SAP, including the Joule copilot on mobile devices and AI-embedded scenarios. Learn how you can leverage SAP Design System and our UI technologies to build your own apps. 

Join our live Mobile AI usability testing session: Exploring Joule and voice – understanding mobile AI in your daily work 
Usability testing offers a unique opportunity for SAP users to engage directly with SAP product and development teams. In a focused 60-minute one-on-one session, you’ll interact with product screens and evaluate whether the buttons, terminology, and features meet your expectations and workflow needs. This session focuses on how AI on mobile is used in everyday work and what users envision for the future.

Do not miss this opportunity and join us in Berlin. Register now! 📅November 4 - 6, 2025 Berlin 
We look forward to meeting and interacting with you!

entry.title: SAP TechEd on Tour is Coming to Sydney!
entry.content:
Big news! SAP TechEd on Tour is landing in Sydney this November as part of Mastering SAP Collaborate From 12–14 November 2025, the ICC Sydney will become the ultimate hub for learning, innovation, and connecting with the SAP community.

 

Why You Can’t Miss This

This isn’t just another conference. This is where experts meet learners, tech meets business and where the #SAPCommunity comes alive.

Here’s what’s waiting for you:

  • Tracks covering everything from AI & Joule to Data & Analytics, S/4HANA Core, Security & Risk, Finance, Integration, HCM, and more.
  • Practical, hands-on learning you can use to solve business challenges
  • Networking with peers, partners, and SAP leaders who share your challenges (and solutions!)

 

Developers, This One’s for You

Our SAP Developer Advocates are joining us in Sydney - bringing fresh insights, live demos, and their best tips.

Don’t miss the Developer Garage. Your playground to:

  • Get hands-on with SAP BTP, AI, and App Dev
  • Learn new topics at your own pace
  • Experiment with guidance from SAP experts right beside you

 

This year is packed with possibilities! You can dive into building AI agents with Joule, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, accelerate full-stack app development with GenAI, and modernize your integration landscape with SAP Integration Suite.

And that’s not all. SAP Mentors and SAP Champions will also be in the house, sharing their expertise, experiences, and community spirit. A perfect chance to connect with the people who inspire and guide the global SAP ecosystem.

Get the knowledge & then get certified with a 25% savings

Another great reason to be part of this event, is the 25% discount on any SAP Certification exam. Come and explore the most up-to-date official SAP TechEd knowledge and knowhow, and then put it to good use as part of your certification prep. The 25% saving offer is valid to 19 December. More details can be found here.

Be Part of It

If you are in the SAP ecosystem, this is the event. Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, or business leader - there’s something here for you.

📅 12–14 November 2025
📍 ICC Sydney Exhibition Centre

View the agenda here.

Register here.

entry.title: Join SAPUI5 Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Dear UI5 enthusiasts,

SAP TechEd 2025 is where UI5 developers meet to enhance their knowledge and get hands-on experience. This is the type of content you like to see: Understand the strategy, see highlights and try out latest capabilities around SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements.

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are in full swing in SAP. As you probably know, SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP’s technologies. It also offers an excellent opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts.

 

SAP TechEd 2025: Registration is live – check out our brand new hybrid experience!

Access the full SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin and SAP TechEd Virtual and see my shortlist here:

Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there’s a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let’s get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever.

Strategy Talks

ST117 | SAP’s user experience strategy with SAP Build
An intuitive user experience is essential for every business user. Examine SAP’s strategy for evolving SAP Build Work Zone to empower a streamlined digital workplace, and for building efficient SAP Fiori apps with SAPUI5. Hear how SAP is advancing with Joule, our AI copilot, now embedded across SAP Build solutions.

ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools - also available virtually as ST116v
Explore the most recent innovations in SAP Build solutions that help developers to create extensions, applications, and automations. Learn how enhancements in the development environment, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, and Joule copilot empower customers and partners to build extensions efficiently at scale.

Deep Dives

AD106 | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build - also available virtually as AD106v
Discover what’s new in SAPUI5 development with SAP Build solutions. Learn to build modern SAP Fiori apps across ABAP and the cloud using new developer tools, Joule technology integration, and proven SAPUI5 capabilities. Get insights into SAP’s UI strategy with SAP Web Components and see how you can benefit. Elevate your UI with SAPUI5 in SAP Build.

AD203 | Fact-checking UI extensibility on cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you
SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps in a clean core approach. Key users use drag-and-drop tools while developers add custom code with visual editors and the Joule copilot. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and ABAP RESTful application programming model help extend data models and add custom logic in SAP Build solutions.

AD100 | Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build
The Joule for developers add-on combines all the AI capabilities in SAP Build solutions. Learn about AI-driven development and how developer productivity can be increased. Developers can use our productivity tools to make their lives easier when engaging in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development.

CA105 | Intelligent app development at scale with AI and SAP Fiori elements

With exciting updates to building blocks, a streamlined entry page, and powerful generative AI in SAP Fiori tools, developers can build applications faster than ever. Get a first look at how we integrate MCP to orchestrate AI capabilities across SAP Fiori tools and SAP Fiori elements for faster app development.

AD201 | Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build: What's in it for ABAP developers

Understand the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud into SAP Build solutions. Find out how you can benefit from this for SAP Fiori app development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP core data services models conveniently. Finally, get insight into our future direction.

Roadmap Sessions

AD818 | Explore the road map for user experience with SAP Build
SAP Build solutions feature many new and upcoming user experience capabilities. Find out how SAP Build Work Zone delivers a connected, intuitive digital workplace, including the SAP Mobile Start app. Understand SAP's road map for building SAP Fiori apps with SAPUI5. See how the Joule copilot supports user and developer productivity.

AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions - also available virtually as AD820v
Check out upcoming enhancements to SAP Build solutions involving SAP’s professional developer tools, the Joule copilot, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These updates boost developer productivity, support clean core, and improve extensibility for line-of-business (LoB) apps, advancing enterprise app development.

Hands-on Workshops

AD166 | Taking UI to the next level: Develop SAPUI5 with SAP Build
Use SAP Build solutions to develop a modern app with SAPUI5. Explore latest best practices, including the UI5 linter and TypeScript to build a future-proof app. Get to know SAP Web Components and leverage them in your SAPUI5 app. Gain hands-on experience, ask questions, and see how Joule technology supports you with AI-based SAPUI5 magic.

AD260 | UI extensibility on top of cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you
SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps with a clean core approach. Key users and developers can add custom code with visual editors and Joule technology. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and the ABAP RESTful application programming model support extending data models and adding custom logic in the SAP Build solution.

AD160 | Get hands-on with Joule: Boost your SAP Build development with AI
The Joule for developers add-on brings AI capabilities directly into SAP Build solutions to support your development process. Get hands-on experience using AI-driven tools to boost your productivity in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development, with features designed to simplify your workflow and help you build faster and smarter.

CA261 | Create great UX with AI, SAP Design System, SAP Fiori elements, and SAPUI5

Learn how to create new SAP applications with great UX and AI using the reusable components, patterns, and floor plans in SAP Design System. Design with the SAP Fiori for Web UI kit from Figma, harness AI and the MCP protocol for automated app generation and real-time adaptation of SAP Fiori elements, and extend freestyle in SAPUI5.

AD163 | Fusion development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build

Practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build solutions by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the lobby for SAP Build to develop an ABAP RESTful application programming model business object, including an SAP Fiori app on top.

It sounds awesome, right? I KNOW!
See you there...

entry.title: My Expert Playlist - SAP TechEd 2025 | SAP Champion - Kunal Bansal 🏆
entry.content:
See you at TechEd on Tour, Bangalore

Hello SAP Community,

I'm excited to be part of SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore on November 25-26, 2025.

SAP TechEd has always been the place where innovation, technology, and community come together.
As a CX Solution Architect and SAP Champion, I’ve curated my must-attend sessions that align with my learning journey. 🏆

Must Join Keynotes

  1. KEY100v | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
  2. KEY101v | Draft day for developers: Turning new technology into real-world wins

My Top Session Picks

  1. DT102v | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business
    To strengthen my understanding of GROW with SAP vs RISE with SAP journeys and guide clients.
  2. IN100v | Make your enterprise future-ready with SAP Integration Suite
    To gain insights into migration from PI/PO to Integration Suite and design future-ready integration for CX.
  3. IN800v | Innovations, investments, and future roadmap for SAP Integration Suite
    To explore SAP’s roadmap on APIs, event-driven architecture, and AI-driven automation for agile solutions.
  4. DA806v | SAP Business Data Cloud solution roadmap
    To learn what’s next for SAP BDC in connectivity and intelligent applications that power data strategies.
  5. ST115v | SAP HANA Cloud: The database for business AI
    To explore how HANA Cloud enables multi-model processing and generative AI for intelligent CX engagement.
  6. DA203v | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP BW
    To see strategies for modernising SAP BW with BDC while reducing risks and enabling advanced analytics.
  7. AI823v | Roadmap: What’s planned for Joule Agents
    To understand SAP’s plans for secure, governed deployment and lifecycle of Joule Agents in automation.
  8. XP100v | Accelerate adoption of SAP BTP with confidence
    To learn how SAP Business Technology Platform adoption can be accelerated.

The above sessions cover strategy, integration, data, AI, and adoption, the building blocks of the Intelligent Enterprise.

For me, TechEd is more than a conference - it’s about curiosity, community, and co-innovation.

  • ✅ Register now for SAP TechEd or join SAP TechEd Virtual
  • ✅Join the SAP TechEd Community Group

What are your top picks? Comment below!

Best Regards,
Kunal Bansal
SAP Champion & SAP Solution Architect

Follow @KatherineKenneally @lauraschmitz @lenastodal @StephanieMarley

entry.title: Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM
entry.content:
Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM 

Over the years, working in customer experience and digital technologies, I have witnessed the rapid evolution of both customers and the infrastructure needed to serve them.  When you consider the “customer,” the need to understand who they are has become a central focus of the user experience. The world of digital identity has continuously adapted. Social logins once felt like the future—now, passwordless or passkey authentication is a requirement. Data privacy has shifted from an afterthought to a boardroom priority, largely driven by regulations like GDPR, CCPA, and others. What used to be considered "good enough" security no longer suffices, as becoming the subject of a data breach headline is a risk no company can afford.. 

Even my daughter now warns me not to share her identity online, as I don’t have her consent—proof that awareness of digital risks is becoming second nature to the next generation. In this new era, trust isn't a nice-to-have; it’s the foundation of every customer interaction. 

That’s why Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) is a critical part of any modern digital strategy and future-forward IT landscape. When organizations get digital identity right, they unlock more than just security—they create better, more trusted customer experiences at every touchpoint. 

 

Bridge the Gap Between Experience and Trust 

In today's digital-first landscape, businesses must navigate the challenge of delivering seamless customer experiences while ensuring robust data protection—a balance that is crucial for building trust with increasingly privacy-conscious consumers. However, many organizations are stuck navigating data silos, which fragment customer insights and prevent a unified understanding of their audience.  

SAP CIAM offers a comprehensive solution to these challenges by unifying data management, enhancing security frameworks, and simplifying privacy compliance. It empowers businesses to protect against threats, manage identities efficiently, and offer personalized user experiences that foster customer loyalty. 

SAP CIAM overcomes the limitations of outdated systems and enables organizations to confidently: 

  1. Secure users 
  1. Reduce privacy concerns 
  1. Scale efficiently 

 

  1. Secure Users and Safeguard Data  

Concerned about data breaches? SAP CIAM is engineered to protect your customer data and minimize security risks, building trust between you and your customers. By prioritizing robust threat detection and protection, this solution ensures your business remains secure, fostering loyalty and reinforcing customer confidence in sharing their data.   

  • Access real-time password suggestions 
  • Utilize built-in screen sets for password updates 
  • Generate one-time passwords 
  • Integrate with external identity services 
  • Enable biometric sign-in for secure login 
  • Harness AI risk-based authentication 

 

For a deeper look at how SAP CIAM addresses today’s evolving security landscape, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more. 

 

  1. Reduce Privacy Compliance Risk 

Keeping up with evolving privacy regulations can be daunting. SAP CIAM simplifies these challenges through efficient consent management capabilities, enabling businesses to adhere to global standards like ISO, BSI, and SOC 2. With user-friendly self-service portals, SAP CIAM respects customer privacy while maintaining compliance—ultimately strengthening trusting relationships. 

  • Capture consent across all channels 
  • Customize for privacy policies and brand 
  • Configure single sign-on (SSO) 
  • Enable global access 

 

  1. Increase Efficiency at Scale 

Worried about system overload during peak times? SAP CIAM effortlessly manages traffic spikes, supporting billions of unique identities and transactions monthly. This capability allows businesses to capitalize on each opportunity without technical setbacks or undue stress on IT teams. With 347 million active users across 85 thousand sites, SAP CIAM is a proven solution for large-scale digital operations. 

  • Design and execute identity flows 
  • Duplicate site configurations and settings 
  • Offer OOTB, OIDC-compliant login experiences 
  • Create identity screens with drag-and-drop 

 

Elevate Your Identity Strategy with SAP CIAM 

SAP CIAM empowers businesses to bolster their security measures, ensure data privacy compliance, and efficiently scale their digital operations. Additionally, it offers pre-configured connectivity with over 60 SAP products, including SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP S/4HANA, SAP Customer Experience solutions, and SAP cloud ERP solutions, enhancing integration across your enterprise. 

Incorporating SAP CIAM into your digital strategy could be the next step toward elevating your business with enhanced security, data protection, and scalability. 

 

Learn more here.

entry.title: A day in the life of a developer for cloud ERP at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
For me as a developer, TechEd is like being a kid in a candy store. Everywhere I look there are new tools, frameworks, and patterns that I want to try out. The best part is that I do not just hear about them, I actually get to test them in hands-on sessions and discuss them directly with the people who build them.

At TechEd 2025 in Berlin my agenda is packed with sessions where I can dive into code, explore AI-driven capabilities like Joule, and understand how to build scalable extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Day 1

  • 9:30 AM - 9:50 AM CET
    CT1234 | SAP BTP as the foundation for Partner SaaS Solutions
  • 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET
    AD162 | Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET
    AD169 | Empower your enterprise: Integrate custom AI agents with any system
  • 2:30 PM - 3:15 PM CET
    DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • 1:30 PM - 1:55 PM CET:
    ST118 | The future of enterprise automation: Workflows, Joule skills, and AI agents
  • 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 3:15 PM - 4:00 PM CET:
    AD100 | Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT104 | Scalable extensions for SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3

  • 9:00 AM - 9:25 AM CET:
    ST113 | Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
  • 10:00 AM - 10:45 AM:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET:
    DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP

Final thoughts

What I value most about TechEd is that I get to experiment with real code and frameworks that I can immediately take back to my projects. This year’s agenda gives me everything I want as a developer: ABAP Cloud in action, clean core best practices, and plenty of opportunities to explore how Joule and AI agents can enhance my development work.

When I return from Berlin, I know I will bring back not just notes, but working examples, patterns I can reuse, and new skills that will help me deliver extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Save the date and register today
 November 4-6, 2025 
SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: SAP Developer News October 2nd, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Devtoberfest Week 2 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-what-is-happening-week-2/ba-p/14233248#M800 

 

Petoberfest 

  • Blog post for uploading pictures: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-2-petoberfest/ba-p/14209744 

 

reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

  • reCAP 2025 (Yellow Room Track) playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJDFklpD_2cT6lFS3kSq55bUmzTUi9bn7 

 

Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

  • Scavenger Hunt main Blog post : https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972 

 

What’s New in SAP HANA Cloud – 2025/Q3 

  • What’s New in SAP HANA Cloud – September 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-hana-cloud-september-2025/ba-p/14228564 
  • Release highlights: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/thomashammersap_saphanacloud-innovation-clouddata-activity-7376676583241195520-5nz6/ 
  • Calculation View Features of 2025 QRC3: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/calculation-view-features-of-2025-qrc3/ba-p/14192411 
  • 🔵 Leveraging Calculation Views in SAP BAS: an Introduction: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/leveraging-calculation-views-in-sap-bas-an-introduction/ec-p/14208844#M1081 
  • 🔵 Developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications with SAP Business Application Studio and Joule: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/developing-ai-driven-sap-hana-cloud-applications-with-sap-business/ev-p/14220020  

 

Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour – Bangalore 2025 

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/call-for-community-talk-speakers-step-into-the-spotlight-at-sap-teched-on/ba-p/14226945 

 

UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

  • Call for Proposals: https://openui5.org/ui5con/bengaluru2025/index.html 
  • SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?PRODUCT=73554900100800001361&range=CURRENT-LAST#Q4%202025 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Week 2 
 
0:31 Petoberfest  

1:48 reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

2:37 Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

4:03 What’s New in SAP HANA Cloud – 2025/Q3 

5:36 Call for Community Talk Speakers SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 2025 

6:40 UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 2nd, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey everyone, week one of Devtoberfest is almost over. If you want to check out what activities we've planned for week two, head over to the community, to the Devtoberfest group, and look out for the blog post, Devtoberfest, week two activities. See you there.

[Daniel] I'm here with Pepper, a flat coat retriever, to announce Petoberfest, where you can upload a picture of your pet, or your favorite zoo creature, or stuffed animal, or any furry friend you fancy. Just upload the picture as a comment to my blog post. In addition, use that picture as the basis for an AI-generated image of your pet. For example, hybris Pepper helping me with my Devtoberfest crosswords and wearing her favorite hat. Be creative both in the setup and the style. Petoberfest this year coincides with World Animal Day, so you can also upload a picture of yourself taking part in any animal welfare project. For example, renovating a straight cat hotel or walking to raise money for your local ASPCA. if you upload a picture you will win oodles of points for the devtoberfest grand prize so i'm looking forward to seeing a picture of your pet good news for all you cat fans the rest of the session

[DJ] recordings from recap 2025 are now online on youtube for your queuing and viewing pleasure now we already had the recordings of the sessions from the blue room track on the recap on conference youtube channel and now after getting hold of the recording from the audimax theater we've got the sessions from the yellow room track cut and organized into individual videos and they're in a playlist for you as well the playlist follows the agenda order. And yes, we processed everything with a little bash script and everything on the command line. The future really is terminal.

[Shrini] The scavenger hunt event runs across multiple weeks of Devtoberfest. I hope you already figured out the three clues we gave out and you have a 12-digit hexadecimal number with you. If not, you may pause this video and check out the clues we released earlier from the main blog post on the scavenger end and come back for the fourth clue. For the fourth clue we can explore some github repositories as the clue is hidden in one of the repositories. Many of you may be aware of the SAP GitHub org SAP samples. It contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, Code Jam material and hundreds of reports from which you can learn about ABAP, CAP, BUILD, and other SAP-related technology. Among the various repos, take a closer look at the SAP BTP AI Best Practices repo to find the two-character clue. This repo contains best practices, sample implementations, to build AI-powered applications and serves as a practical guide for developers looking to implement enterprise-grade AI solutions using SAP AI services and integration with generative AI models. To find the clue number four, you don't have to clone the repo. You can look around the repo, access various tabs, search within the repo for some common terms related to desktop office like build, ABAP, CAP, AI, etc. Happy hunting!

[Witalij] Before we dive in, a quick note. Our cat Felicia decided it was the perfect time for an app, so she's not joining today. But I'm here and there is plenty to share. We've just released the third SAP HANA Cloud update of 2025, packed with meaningful advancements. Here are a few highlights I've personally chosen. Vector embedding SQL functions now supports the generative AI hub, helping you integrate different models more easily. JSON is now a native data type in the document store, simplifying work with the unstructured data. Single sign-on for data lake files enhances security and accessibility. And with drill in SAP build code, you can generate SQL from natural language, making development faster and more intuitive, and you can feel like a wipe coder now. For all the details, check out the dedicated blog post or the product team's teaser video. If data modeling is your focus. Don't miss Jan Zwickal's deep-dive post on the latest in graphical view modeling. He also spoke at Devtoberfest this week. Recordings are already available, if you missed it. Finally, mark your calendar for next Thursday as well, as Christoph Morgan will explore developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications live at Devtoberfest. It's a great chance to see these features in action? Let us know what stands out to you.

[Tom] If you're in the India region, we've got an interesting opportunity for you to join the SAP TechEd On Tour in Bangalore coming up at the end of November. The community talk call for speakers is now open. If you're interested in sharing your experience or your knowledge about a particular topic in the SAP Space, this is your opportunity to get a free lecture only ticket to the SAP TechEd on Tour taking place in Bangalore. You only have until October 10th to submit your session proposal, so be sure to act quickly. We look forward to seeing you at TechEd Berlin as most of the developer advocates team will be there. We'll be cheering you on and helping mentor you for your presentation as well. So this is a great opportunity for anybody looking to get a ticket to TechEd on Tour Bangalore and to share their knowledge at the event. So look forward to seeing you there.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the developer news. Your 5-card 2025 in Bangalore is going to happen in December and the call for proposals is now open. You can submit your session proposal until October 31st. There is quickfire presentations, around 20 minutes long, in-depth sessions, 40 minutes, or longer hands-on workshops. Definitely check that out if you want to have a session at UI5Con in Bangalore. Also related to UI5, there is a new version of the SAP UI5 RoadMavic store with some interesting items on there regarding AI, obviously. There is new AI related controls and also interesting MCP items. So definitely check that one out if you are interested in SAPUI5. All right, hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

entry.title: From Penalty to Power Play: Why Identity Management Is Key to Better Customer Experiences
entry.content:
A few weeks ago, a friend bought tickets to a hockey game and wanted to transfer them to me. Like many people, we went with the quickest workaround—she shared her login credentials so I could access the tickets. But what should have been a simple process turned into several days of password resets, missed messages, and back-and-forth. By the time I finally got into her account, the tickets were gone. She had attempted to transfer them during the delay, but amid the confusion and technical issues, I never actually received them. If I had been able to log in right away, I could have just downloaded them directly. But the access issues created confusion, and without any clear support from the platform, we ended up losing the tickets—and missing the game.

It was a simple plan that fell apart because of something as basic as account access.

This experience is a small example of a much larger issue in digital commerce: the friction that arises when identity management isn’t built with the customer in mind. It’s easy to overlook, but poor identity experiences lead directly to lost opportunities—not just for consumers, but for the businesses trying to reach them.

 

Identity Friction = Lost Revenue

In today’s commerce landscape, customer expectations are sky-high. If a login process is confusing, if an account is hard to access, or if personalization feels off—people walk away. And often, they don’t come back.

Poor identity experiences hurt businesses in more ways than one:

  • They interrupt the buying journey. Whether it’s a login loop, a forgotten password, or a complicated checkout flow, friction at these key points drives abandonment.
  • They block personalization. When customer data is fragmented across systems, it’s hard to deliver the tailored experiences that today’s buyers expect.
  • They erode trust. Without clear consent management and transparency, customers hesitate to share information—or stop engaging entirely.
  • They slow down growth. Outdated systems and homegrown solutions often can’t keep up with omnichannel strategies or evolving compliance needs.

For a deeper dive into how SAP CIAM can help reduce identity friction, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more.

 

Where SAP CIAM + Commerce Cloud Make the Difference

Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) helps solve these challenges by making identity work for the customer—not against them. When integrated into your commerce ecosystem, CIAM doesn't just handle sign-ins—it actively supports better customer relationships and business outcomes.

Here’s how:

  • It reduces friction at every stage—from anonymous browsing to account creation to repeat purchases. The experience becomes smoother, simpler, and more secure.
  • It improves conversion by enabling personalized, real-time engagement without relying on clunky data handoffs or third-party cookies.
  • It builds trust by giving customers control over their data, preferences, and permissions—while helping businesses stay compliant across regions.
  • It supports scale by integrating identity across every digital touchpoint, enabling consistent experiences on web, mobile, in-store, and beyond.

In short, CIAM allows businesses to move away from fragmented, frustrating interactions and toward a unified customer experience that feels intuitive, safe, and relevant—every time. To hear firsthand how SAP customers are achieving this with SAP CIAM and Commerce Cloud, join us at SAP Connect in Las Vegas on October 8. Register here to attend.

 

The Takeaway

In commerce, moments of friction are more than just annoyances—they’re missed opportunities. Whether it’s lost hockey tickets or lost revenue, the cause is often the same: a broken identity experience.

Modern CIAM, especially when combined with a powerful commerce platform, turns identity into an asset. It streamlines the journey, protects the user, and empowers businesses to engage with clarity and confidence.

And the best part? It just works—so your customers don’t have to. 

Learn more here.

entry.title: 🚀 SAP BTP Weekly | Innovación segura, automatización inteligente y futuro sostenible
entry.content:
🛡️ 1️⃣ Seguridad mejorada en BTP: rotación automática de claves y CAPTCHA ampliado

🔹 SAP anunció en su Q3 2025 mejoras clave en Security & Identity Management. 🔹 Incluye rotación automática de claves de acceso, nuevos logs de aprovisionamiento en tiempo real y protección CAPTCHA incluso para verificación telefónica. 🔹 También llegan comandos de consola para certificados personalizados.

💬 Análisis: SAP sigue fortaleciendo la capa operativa de seguridad. La rotación automática reduce riesgos humanos, pero exige revisar integraciones para que las apps soporten las nuevas claves. Además, las APIs y logs abren la puerta a integraciones con SIEM corporativos.

📎 Q3 2025 Quarterly Release Highlights: SAP BTP Security & IAM ❓ ¿Tus pipelines ya contemplan rotación automática de credenciales o siguen siendo manuales?

🧱 2️⃣ Riesgos en arquitecturas híbridas: seguridad entre BTP y el core

El crecimiento de BTP en entornos híbridos trajo nuevos retos: ⚙️ conexiones mal configuradas, 👤 cuentas técnicas con privilegios excesivos, 🚨 y falta de monitoreo entre sistemas on-premise y cloud.

Onapsis recomienda aplicar el principio de menor privilegio, segmentar destinos y usar alertas de comportamiento anómalo.

💬 Análisis: La promesa del híbrido es flexibilidad, pero también implica más puntos vulnerables. Cada destino en BTP es una posible puerta lateral si no se gestiona bien. La buena noticia: SAP ya integra alertas y trazabilidad más robustas; la mala, que muchas organizaciones aún no tienen visibilidad unificada de sus conexiones. Un gobierno efectivo requiere mapear todos los destinos, controlar privilegios y automatizar validaciones.Para el CIO, esto no es un problema técnico: es un riesgo reputacional si una brecha surge desde el entorno cloud.

📎 Securing the Bridge – Onapsis

🎓 3️⃣ SAP TechEd 2025: confianza, IA y estrategia BTP

📍 Berlín y online | 4–6 noviembre Este año, SAP TechEd pone el foco en IA responsable, seguridad y automatización empresarial. La pista “Building Trust on BTP” mostrará cómo aplicar IA generativa con cumplimiento normativo, y habrá nuevas certificaciones en SAP Build y AI Developer.

💬 Análisis: TechEd siempre marca tendencias. Este año, SAP busca demostrar que IA y seguridad no son opuestos, sino complementarios. La idea de “trust by design” será central: usar IA generativa bajo marcos de control auditables. Para los arquitectos, esto significa que el BTP no solo será más inteligente, sino también más predecible. Y para los líderes de negocio, TechEd será el momento de evaluar cómo conectar Joule y Build con la realidad operativa.

📎 Agenda oficial SAP TechEd 2025

🤖 4️⃣ Joule Studio y automatización inteligente

SAP Joule Studio permite crear agentes de IA sin código directamente sobre Build Process Automation. Un CFO o analista puede describir en lenguaje natural un proceso, y Joule lo convierte en flujo automatizado. El reto: asegurar trazabilidad y control en automatizaciones generadas por usuarios.

💬 Análisis: Este paso cambia el juego: los procesos dejan de ser diseñados solo por TI. Con Joule Studio, áreas como Finanzas o RRHH pueden construir automatizaciones útiles en minutos. Sin embargo, el reto está en la gobernanza: definir quién puede crear, auditar y modificar esos flujos. El CIO gana velocidad, pero debe mantener control. El equilibrio entre autonomía y seguridad definirá el éxito.

📎 SAP Joule Studio

♻️ 5️⃣ FinOps y sostenibilidad: control financiero y ambiental en una sola vista

SAP refuerza su visión ESG con Sustainability Control Tower y Green Ledger, integradas con BTP y S/4HANA Cloud. CFOs y COOs pueden medir impacto ambiental junto al financiero, automatizando reportes ESG. Combinado con FinOps, permite reducir gastos cloud y alinear sostenibilidad y rentabilidad.

💬 Análisis: El control financiero y la sostenibilidad se vuelven inseparables. BTP permite que el impacto ambiental se mida con el mismo rigor que el financiero. Para el CFO, significa tener visibilidad completa de costos y emisiones. Para TI, implica integrar métricas ESG dentro de los procesos operativos. Este enfoque convierte la sostenibilidad en una ventaja competitiva, no en un “compliance más”.

📎 SAP Sustainability Control Tower

🧩 6️⃣ Extensibilidad guiada: el “wizard” que simplifica SAP Build y CAP

El nuevo Extensibility Wizard ayuda a construir extensiones seguras para S/4HANA desde BTP, asegurando compatibilidad con upgrades y manteniendo el clean core. Menos “custom code spaghetti”, más agilidad y trazabilidad.

💬 Análisis: SAP da un paso firme hacia la estandarización de extensiones. El wizard facilita que incluso equipos sin experiencia profunda en ABAP construyan ampliaciones seguras y mantenibles. Esto acelera proyectos sin comprometer el core. El desafío: convencer a los equipos de desarrollo tradicionales de abandonar el “custom code” artesanal y adoptar un enfoque guiado, pero más sostenible.

📎 Extensibility Wizard – Blog SAP

🔗 7️⃣ Joule + Microsoft Copilot: colaboración aumentada entre ecosistemas

La alianza SAP–Microsoft da un paso más: Joule se integra con Microsoft 365 Copilot, permitiendo consultar y accionar datos SAP directamente desde Teams, Outlook o Excel. Ejemplo: “¿Cuál fue el gasto real del Q3?” — y Joule responde en segundos con datos de SAP Analytics Cloud. Una nueva forma de productividad aumentada, donde BTP se convierte en el puente entre AI empresarial y colaboración diaria.

💬 Análisis: La frontera entre ERP y oficina se difumina. Con Joule + Copilot, un usuario puede consultar información crítica de SAP sin salir de Teams. Esto convierte la colaboración diaria en un entorno de decisión asistida por IA. Para los CIOs, implica una nueva prioridad: gobernar el acceso a datos sensibles que ahora fluyen por herramientas colaborativas. Una integración poderosa, pero que exige políticas sólidas de seguridad y contexto de uso.

📎 SAP + Microsoft AI Partnership

¿Qué equilibrio te resulta más desafiante hoy? 👉 Seguridad 👉 Velocidad 👉 Gobernanza

Déjamelo en los comentarios — la transformación BTP la construimos entre todos 💬

entry.title: My Expert Playlist for SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin
entry.content:
TechEd is finally back in Europe, and I couldn't be more excited! This year, I'm going all-in on AI-related sessions.

Yeah, AI again... but hear me out

I know, I know—AI is everywhere right now and it's easy to feel like it's overrated. But honestly? I think this is where the real innovation is happening. Not the flashy stuff, but the simple improvements that actually make our business processes better. That's what I'm looking for at TechEd—practical innovation from SAP that I can actually use.

Here's what's on my list:

Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents - AD202
I hope this one will help me build AI agents that actually work (and not just in demos).

How to simplify administration tasks in SAP BTP with Joule - XP101
Anything that can automate my work and make my life easier? Sign me up.

Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub - AI100
Call me crazy, but I think future applications will be AI-driven without traditional UIs. This session should show me how.

SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse - DA203
Data is everything when it comes to getting good AI results. This might be the key piece I'm missing.

Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio - AI105
I need to understand how to combine skills with agents properly—that's where things get interesting.

Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build - AD100
As a developer, I want to know what Joule can actually do to support my workflow. Vibe coding, anyone?

The AI stack is ready—are you? The challenge no longer is technology - CT1277
The million-dollar question: Is SAP's AI stack really ready for us? Can't wait to find out. 🙂

It's not just AI, it's the key to innovation 😉

Apart from all the AI stuff, I'm also looking forward to:

  • The keynote - expectations are high with Joule Studio just launching and TechEd being back in Europe
  • Community talks - want to hear something SAP won't tell you? Check these out
  • DemoJam - it's back after years (not just because of Covid)! Looking forward to seeing some cool innovations

Let's connect!

What's on your list? Going heavy on AI like me or checking out other tracks?

Not registered yet? Get your ticket
Join the conversation: SAP TechEd Community Group

#SAPTechEd #MyExpertPlaylist

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: DA263 | SAP HANA Cloud - Advisors and automation
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Jinhee Jeong and I’m a Product Manager for SAP HANA Cloud, with a focus on Intelligent Automation involving various advisors and automation features for cloud database administration and optimization.

My session:

DA263 | SAP HANA Cloud: Advisors and automation   /  Nov 6 (Thursday) 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM CET

What you will learn about:

This hands-on workshop session will transform how you optimize your SAP HANA Cloud databases! Join me as we explore the powerful intelligent advisors available in HANA Cloud Central, where you'll learn to configure and leverage the Elastic Compute Node Advisor, Partition Advisor, and Index Advisor.

This interactive session is designed to give you practical experience in generating intelligent database optimization recommendations that can improve your system performance. We'll dive deep into the configuration process for each advisor, and learn multiple proven approaches for implementing these recommendations.

Whether you're a database administrator, developer, or SAP professional looking to enhance your optimization skills, this workshop will provide you with actionable insights and hands-on techniques you can apply immediately. Don't miss this opportunity to master these essential tools and take your SAP HANA Cloud database performance to the next level!

Other related sessions I recommend:

ST115 | SAP HANA Cloud: The database for business AI

DA817 | What's next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road map and innovation highlights

DA200 | Help future-proof your database landscape with SAP HANA Cloud

DA201 | Accelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud

DA202 | Extensibility at scale: Build intelligent applications with SAP HANA Cloud

DA261 | Unlocking AI-driven insights from your business data in SAP HANA Cloud

Related community topic pages:

SAP HANA On-premises and Cloud Databases

Looking forward to seeing you:

Ready to supercharge your SAP HANA Cloud database performance? Register now for this hands-on workshop and discover how to unlock the full potential of HANA Cloud Central's intelligent advisors! Space is limited, so secure your spot today and join fellow SAP professionals in mastering these tools.

Now let's hear from you:

Are you familiar with SAP HANA Cloud? or HANA Cloud Central, the administration tool? Do you have any specific expectations on this hands-on workshop based on your previous experience? Feel free to share your expectations or insights in the comment!

entry.title: Get Ready for SAP TechEd with Data and Analytics Learning Opportunities
entry.content:
SAP TechEd is right around the corner- the perfect time to strengthen your data and analytics skills. Explore learning paths designed to help you connect, model, and analyze data with confidence, and discover how to transform insight into real business impact. Build your expertise through self-paced learning journeys, instructor-led trainings, interactive value journeys, demos, and basic trials. 

🎓 Certification benefits: 

  • All SAP TechEd and SAP TechEd on Tour participants receive a 25% discount on SAP Certification, with two exam attempts. 
  •  If you’re attending in person in Berlin, Bangalore, or Louisville, you can take a free certification exam on site 

Get a head start on your SAP TechEd journey with the latest learning and certification resources.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: DA262-Enabling clean core development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Shraddha Shetty and I’m a Product Manager on the SAP HANA Product Management team, with a focus on Developer Experience. I began my journey at SAP in 2021 as a Developer and later transitioned into Product Management.

Join My Session!
DA262 | Enabling Clean Core Development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code
🗓️ Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM – 5:30 PM CET

What you will learn about:

Join our hands-on workshop DA262 | Enabling Clean Core Development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code to explore how side-by-side extensions can help you innovate without compromising your clean core.

In this hands-on session, you’ll explore how SAP HANA Cloud, the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), and SAP Build Code work together to simplify and accelerate development. Through guided exercises, participants will learn to create full-stack applications, integrate business services, and extend SAP solutions with agility and intelligence. You’ll also get hands-on experience exploring HANA Cloud features such as adding native artifacts, and accessing data lake files to build smarter, data-driven applications.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll gain practical insights and skills to confidently build scalable, cloud-ready applications while maintaining a clean and extensible core. Don’t miss this opportunity to enhance your developer experience and unlock the full potential of SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code.

Co-speakers:

  • Thomas Hammer  – Lead Product Manager, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP SE

  • Christoph Morgen – Senior Product Manager, SAP HANA Cloud AI, SAP SE

  • Roman Belosludtsev – Product Manager, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP SE

Other related sessions I recommend:

DA261 | Unlocking AI-Driven Insights from Your Business Data in SAP HANA Cloud
Hands-on Workshop
When: Tue, Nov 4 | 12:30 PM – 2:30 PM CET

DA200 | Help Future-Proof Your Database Landscape with SAP HANA Cloud
Deep Dive
When: Wed, Nov 5 | 10:15 AM – 11:00 AM CET

DA202 | Extensibility at Scale: Build Intelligent Applications with SAP HANA Cloud
Deep Dive
When: Wed, Nov 5 | 1:15 PM – 2:00 PM CET

ST115 | SAP HANA Cloud: The Database for Business AI
Strategy Talk
When: Wed, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM – 2:40 PM CET

DA201 | Accelerating Your AI Strategy with SAP HANA Cloud
Deep Dive
When: Thu, Nov 6 | 9:00 AM – 9:45 AM CET

DA263 | SAP HANA Cloud: Advisors and Automation
Hands-on Workshop
When: Thu, Nov 6 | 9:00 AM – 11:00 AM CET

DA817 | What's Next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road Map and Innovation Highlights
Road Map
When: Thu, Nov 6 | 1:30 PM – 1:55 PM CET

DA904 | SAP HANA Cloud: A Database for SAP Business AI
Demo Station

Related community topic pages:

Best Practice collection working with Business Application Studio(BAS) and HANA Deployment Infrastructure(HDI)

Looking forward to seeing you! 👋✨🚀

Don’t miss this opportunity to get hands-on with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code, and learn how to extend your SAP landscape while keeping your core clean. Join us to gain practical skills, connect with experts, and see firsthand how to accelerate innovation in your applications. Register and be part of this interactive workshop.

💬Now let’s hear from you:

As you gear up for SAP TechEd 2025, we’d love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP HANA Cloud and clean core development. Share your insights, ideas, and challenges with us:

  • When building full-stack applications, do you prefer CAP services or other development approaches? Why?

  • How do you currently manage data modeling and business logic in your SAP HANA Cloud applications

  • What are your expectations for SAP TechEd 2025, and which hands-on topics excite you the most?

Drop your thoughts in the comments below
